The issue stems from Bangladesh’s refusal to play in India over security concerns.

title: Prostate cancer symptoms that mimic common age-related problems: Doctor shares warning signs
description: Prostate cancer is a growing concern in India, often missed due to subtle symptoms mistaken for aging. Early signs like frequent urination or blood in urine are frequently ignored. This lack of awareness and discussion delays diagnosis. Experts urge men over 40 to undergo regular check-ups, especially with a family history, to ensure early detection and successful treatment.

AIBE twice a year, final-year students allowed: The Supreme Court just fixed a timing mess
description: India’s bar exam pathway is getting a long-overdue timing fix. The Bar Council of India has told the Supreme Court it has framed new rules allowing final-semester LLB students to sit for the All India Bar Examination, while making the test a twice-a-year exercise. The condition remains clear: students can appear, but must clear their final exams to move forward. For aspirants, this is not just a procedural update—it reduces the risk of losing an entire year to exam cycles and paperwork, and smoothens the jump from law school to practice.

Private developers now offer better planning, amenities, and security, enhancing daily comfort and community life. While government projects remain vital for affordability, private estates provide a superior living experience and investment potential for those who can afford it.

title: 100 stray dogs poisoned near Hyderabad after 500 culled in Telangana
description: Another 100 stray dogs were allegedly poisoned in Yacharam village, Rangareddy district, sparking outrage among animal welfare activists. This incident follows the mass killing of over 500 dogs in Telangana. Police have registered a case against the village sarpanch and two others, with investigations underway to locate the buried carcasses.

title: Why only female Darwin’s bark spiders weave the toughest webs

Its silk has a tensile strength of about 1.6 gigapascals, around 3x higher than that of iron, making it the toughest biological material ever tested

She spoke about her recent extended stay on the ISS, the challenges faced, and the growing commercialization of space. Williams also highlighted the importance of international cooperation in space exploration and inspired Indian students to pursue careers in the sector.

Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: Aastha Shah says vitiligo ‘is not something tragic, contagious': Exclusive
description: Beauty influencer Aastha Shah, living with vitiligo, shares her journey of self-acceptance and finding worth beyond societal standards. She emphasizes that her condition is not tragic and doesn't define her. Shah's decision to embrace her skin publicly, supported by her family, has empowered her and inspired many to live authentically and reject external validation.

title: Mumbai road crash: Auto driver hurt as Mercedes collides with Akshay Kumar’s escort vehicle
‘Will kill you’: Gurgaon doctor reverses, accelerates, runs over Swiggy rider thrice
description: A 41-year-old Ayurvedic doctor was arrested for attempting to murder a Swiggy delivery rider in Gurgaon. The doctor, Naveen, repeatedly rammed his SUV into the rider, Tinku, after a dispute over parking. CCTV footage captured the shocking incident, leading to Naveen's arrest and the seizure of his vehicle.

title: 'I am a British citizen': YouTuber Sangram Patil stopped at Mumbai airport over LOC
description: London-based YouTuber Sangram Patil was prevented from flying back to the UK after a lookout circular issued by Mumbai police remained active. Patil claims the process for its withdrawal was initiated after he was questioned in a defamation case, but immigration officials cited the active notice, curtailing his movement.
